TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WorkflowInstanceManagementBehavior extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior

Docs.summary: A behavior that adds a workflow control endpoint with a fixed configuration to the service host.

Docs.summary: The fixed workflow control relative endpoint address. This address is appended to the base address of the service to create the control endpoint address.
Gets the binding for the workflow instance control endpoint when the HTTP protocol is used.
Docs.value: The binding for the workflow instance control endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The binding is automatically created based on the protocols configured for the service hostâ€™s base address. Messages sent to the workflow instance control endpoint do not contain any personally identifiable information and therefore it need not be encrypted. Messages sent to the workflow control endpoint need to contain the user identity to use for authorization. When the HTTP protocol is enabled, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> is used with the following settings.
1. Transaction flow is enabled.
2. Security mode is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode.Message>.
3. Windows client credentials are used.

Docs.summary: Gets the binding for the workflow instance control endpoint when the net.pipe protocol is used.
Docs.value: The binding for the workflow instance control endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The binding is automatically created based on the protocols configured for the service hostâ€™s base address. Messages sent to the workflow instance control endpoint do not contain any personally identifiable information and therefore it need not be encrypted. Messages sent to the workflow control endpoint need to contain the user identity to use for authorization. When the net.pipe protocol is enabled, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding> is used with the following settings.
1. Transaction flow is enabled.
2. Security mode is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode.Transport>.
3. Transport security level is set to <xref:System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel.Sign>.
4. Windows client credentials are used.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Windows group of users authorized to use the workflow instance control endpoint.
Docs.value: The Windows group of users authorized to use the workflow instance control endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Defaults to "BUILTIN\Administrators". Valid settings are: a local Windows group or a Windows domain.
